Talon:

Talon followed the Dragon, she hardly could move, the pain was agon=
izing. She reached the place where the female dragons indicated aand fell t=
here. She hoped that all be alright, that her baby or babies be alright. 

=
--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@...> wrote:
>
> T=
ucson could see that there was no time to return to base.  He looks around =
and finds a familiar cave.  They had walked a bit of a distance uphill and =
he knew exactly where they were.   The cave behind him is enormous, and an =
old silver scale lies on the ground next to the opening.  The young female =
he had seen earlier, pops her head out and senses that Talon is in need of =
her protective services while giving birth.  She calls to her in quiet bell=
ows.
> 
> " It's alright Talon, she's calling to you, to follow her.  Femal=
e dragons always colonize around their own to protect a new mother and her =
newborns. "
> 
> It was as he explained.  The females gather around Talon a=
nd show her to a place where she can have her baby, on a soft bed of discar=
ded feathers and grasses.  Tucson is gently nudged outside since males are =
not allowed inside until after the birth.  He waits outside with another ol=
der dragon.
> 
> " Wait, please, she's my wife, I have to be there with her=
."
> 
> He tries to go inside but is blocked by an older female.  He lowers=
 his head and backs up a slight.
>

> > > > > > --- In nb=

> > > > > > >
> >=
 > > > > > Tucson looks to the paintings thoughtfully. 
> > > > > > > 
> > =
> > > > > " Yes, I believe you're right Talon. These depictions tell all. A=
nd if this so called other deity is a physical being, then it must be evil,=
 or else it wouldn't be painted in black. And if it is a physical being, it=
 must be stopped. And I have a feeling that perhaps its best if I face this=
 being personally. Now, let's see... This pictograph gives a location.. Ah,=
 I got it, these paintings resemble a path that I happen to know rather wel=
l. And some of this writing.. I think it means " Blight" . Tucson to base, =
over. I have identified an enemy, via pictograph images found on my locatio=
n. The name of our new enemy is Blight, and by the look of the pictographs,=
 he is a Predacon. I will proceed to locate Blight now . Or at least get hi=
m to heed my warning. Tucson out."
> > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > He narrows =
his eyes, leaps up onto a large boulder and gives off his thunderous roar, =
hoping that Blight gets the message.

> > > > > > > >

on ate the fish and looked athe paint and said "Do they think that you are =
actually a sort of deity as well as the other one?"
> > > > > > > > 
> > > =
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@> wrote=
:
> > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > Tucson embraces Talon with his tail a=
round her shoulders.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > " So will I. Talo=
n, so will I. But that doesn't mean we can't try to recreate a little porti=
on of life on our own planet. This seed we were given, it needs soil, water=
, light and something to plant it in. Perhaps we can find a place where the=
re is an abundance of soil and take that with us. "
> > > > > > > > > 
> > =
> > > > > > > Just as he spoke, a Protohuman, carrying an offering of fish,=
 kneels down before Tucson and Talon. Tucson looks to the offering. It was =
a most generous portion of fish. Yet now he could not eat it, but he knew T=
alon would need nourishment. He nods gently to the Protohuman and accepts h=
is offering with a gentile touch of his nose on the man's shoulder. He allo=
ws him to stroke his snout as some sort of good luck ritual. The man bows i=
n graciousness to Tucson's gesture of kindness and leaves him be with Talon=
.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > " I'm not so sure what all of that m=
eant but, whatever it was, it was a very kind gesture on his part. I wonder=
 if these people had any interaction with the old Silver Dragon.. " 
> > > =
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > It isn't long before others come to offer mo=
re gifts to him and Talon. One of the Protohumans points to a painting on a=
 rock, with white portraying silver, in a primitive image of a large reptil=
e with outstretched wings.
> > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > " Oh, I see=
 now.. Yes, they have seen him before. To them he is a guardian, and the mo=
re offerings they gave him, he would return their kind gestures by offering=
 his protection. But there is more to these paintings.. A strange mysteriou=
s figure, with an aura around it.. To me it seems evil. Another idol, someo=
ne else to worship. .. People portrayed in black and white.. White, meaning=
 those who look to the Silver Dragon and black to those who worship the int=
imidating idol.. I've seen ancient pictographs before on Cybertron, and the=
se are different but in the same format. Talon if the dragon is a physical =
being, then this dark idol must be as well. We need to find it, before it l=
ays harm to anyone."

> > > > > > =
> > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > The femme smiled when she saw all those things=
 and said softly "I will miss all this"
> > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > =
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicquartz@> wrote:
> =
> > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > With a gentile smile, Tucson retu=
rns the kiss and holds his wing over them to provide a moment alone with Ta=
lon. After the kiss he lowers his wing and notices that a collection of sma=
ll creatures surrounding him and Talon . Yet they do so in a fashion of adm=
iration rather than hostility. Tucson looks to them curiously.
> > > > > > =
> > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > " I'm not sure why these creatures are cur=
ious about us but it appears as if they're here to admire rather than attac=
k. I wonder... "
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > He stands up =
and gets back into beast mode, and sits down once more. The creatures draw =
closer to him and sit beside him and Talon. It was clear that the Silver Dr=
agon was a source of comfort to these creatures, but that was about to chan=
ge once he and Talon left for Cybertron. It was a massive guilt slammed upo=
n his heart. Yet how could he get the animals to understand that he had to =
leave them in such a short time? He was now their guardian and they were lo=
oking up to him for protection. 
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > >=
 > " Talon, these creatures remember the old dragon that sought to their pr=
otection and realize that I have taken his place. It's as I thought, they a=
ren't aware of who we really are, and where we are from. They will not unde=
rstand that we must leave them shortly, for good, and Primus knows what wil=
l happen to them once we leave. ... Talon, I hear something coming. It's no=
t a Predacon but it's a fairly large creature."
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > =
> > > > > > > > > Not far from them, Tucson spots the scales of a rather la=
rge reptile, that appears to be fishing in the stream next to them. He watc=
hes attentively and at that moment, the creature lifts its head. It was ano=
ther dragon. Yet this one was a bit smaller than he was, but the same color=
ation. He takes note of its slender shape. It was female. She looks to him =
as he looks to her. She slowly approaches him and they look gently to each =
other like brother and sister. In draconic vocalization, Tucson explains wh=
o he is and his dilemma. She intern rumbles back and bows her head. She nod=
s as he does. It was their way of communicating as Tucson looks back to Tal=
on.
> > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > " Apparently the old drago=
n has family here. They are scattered but they exist. And she said that she=
 will protect these creatures and this land along with her brethren for as =
long as they live. And she wishes us good luck on our journey."
> > > > > >=
 > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > With that, the dragoness leaves them peac=
efully to enjoy their time together. With a gentile groan, the creatures to=
o, depart. It was truly a spiritual moment for both of them.
> > > > > > > =

> > > > > > > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <ma=
gicquartz@> wrote:
> > > > > > > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > > > > > > Tucs=
on holds Talon gently with an arm around her shoulders. He looks up and the=
n back to her.
> > > > > > > > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > > " Like =
a branch on a tree that has broken off during a storm and regrows in a diff=
erent direction than it had been, before it had broken off. I know exactly =
how you feel. I feel the same way. At one time, I was blind, rolled on four=
 wheels and I always seemed to be an Autobot rebel. I fought along side wit=
h my comrades but I wasn't good at following orders. I was well grounded bu=
t lost at the same time. Then, I met you and things began to change on a mo=
re positive note. You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my pa=
th, and you saw me on the right road and guided me to my true fate. Soon af=
terwards, I became a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost look=
ed like Optimus Prime, yet different. But one thing didn't change, I was st=
ill battling blindness off and on. Then, a third change, due to extensive d=
amage to my previous form, which could not be repaired, I was guided to my =
final evolution, this one. All of these things wouldn't have come about if =
I had never met you. And I wouldn't have it any other way. Talon, I will mi=
ss this planet as much as you are, and hopefully we can tell our offspring =
all about this planet and it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."
=

 and drops a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.
> > > > > > > > > > > =
> > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > > " This is for us to keep? Thank you, we will=
 take good care of it."

 > > > > > > > " I think we have a way to bring back a small reminder of th=
is planet. Let's see if we can encourage it to grow on ours."

nd Talon's shoulders and looks up into the branches of the tree, but finds =

chuckles and gives the nut back to the rodent.

> > > > > > > > > > >=

anishes into the tree to eat its prize. Tucson was one with the creatures a=
nd it was obvious that they were comfortable around him. 
> > > > > > > > >=
 > > > > > > 
> > > > > > > > > > > > > > > " Talon, I'm going to miss this=
 planet just as much as you are, when we leave for Cybertron. It's just not=
 going to feel like home the way this planet does. But Leo is right, we can=
 not remain here and upset the balance of time. But while we're still here,=
 let's enjoy the moment and continue to explore this part of the forest."
